idl-def-IDBCursor.summary: The IDBCursor interface of the IndexedDB API represents a cursor for traversing or iterating over multiple records in a database.
idl-def-IDBCursor.title: IDBCursor

idl-def-IDBCursorWithValue.summary: The IDBCursorWithValue interface of the IndexedDB API represents a cursor for traversing or iterating over multiple records in a database. It is the same as the IDBCursor, except that it includes the value property.
idl-def-IDBCursorWithValue.title: IDBCursorWithValue

idl-def-IDBDatabase.summary: The IDBDatabase interface of the IndexedDB API provides a connection to a database; you can use an IDBDatabase object to open a transaction on your database then create, manipulate, and delete objects (data) in that database. The interface provides the only way to get and manage versions of the database.
idl-def-IDBDatabase.title: IDBDatabase

idl-def-IDBEnvironment.summary: The IDBEnvironment helper of the IndexedDB API contains the indexedDB property, which provides access to IndexedDB functionality. It is the top level IndexedDB interface implemented by the window and Worker objects.
idl-def-IDBEnvironment.title: IDBEnvironment

idl-def-IDBFactory.summary: In the following code snippet, we make a request to open a database, and include handlers for the success and error cases. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)
idl-def-IDBFactory.title: IDBFactory

idl-def-IDBIndex.summary: IDBIndex interface of the IndexedDB API provides asynchronous access to an index in a database. An index is a kind of object store for looking up records in another object store, called the referenced object store. You use this interface to retrieve data.
idl-def-IDBIndex.title: IDBIndex

idl-def-IDBKeyRange.summary: A key range can be a single value or a range with upper and lower bounds or endpoints. If the key range has both upper and lower bounds, then it is bounded; if it has no bounds, it is unbounded. A bounded key range can either be open (the endpoints are excluded) or closed (the endpoints are included). To retrieve all keys within a certain range, you can use the following code constructs:
idl-def-IDBKeyRange.title: IDBKeyRange

idl-def-IDBObjectStore.summary: This example shows a variety of different uses of object stores, from updating the data structure with IDBObjectStore.createIndex inside an onupgradeneeded function, to adding a new item to our object store with IDBObjectStore.add. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)
idl-def-IDBObjectStore.title: IDBObjectStore

idl-def-IDBOpenDBRequest.summary: Also inherits methods from its parents IDBRequest and EventTarget.
idl-def-IDBOpenDBRequest.title: IDBOpenDBRequest

idl-def-IDBRequest.summary: The request object does not initially contain any information about the result of the operation, but once information becomes available, an event is fired on the request, and the information becomes available through the properties of the IDBRequest instance.
idl-def-IDBRequest.title: IDBRequest

idl-def-IDBVersionChangeEvent.summary: The IDBVersionChangeEvent interface of the IndexedDB API indicates that the version of the database has changed, as the result of an IDBOpenDBRequest.onupgradeneeded event handler function.
idl-def-IDBVersionChangeEvent.title: IDBVersionChangeEvent

transaction.summary: Note that as of Firefox 40, IndexedDB transactions have relaxed durability guarantees to increase performance (see bug 1112702.) Previously in a readwrite transaction IDBTransaction.oncomplete was fired only when all data was guaranteed to have been flushed to disk. In Firefox 40+ the complete event is fired after the OS has been told to write the data but potentially before that data has actually been flushed to disk. The complete event may thus be delivered quicker than before, however, there exists a small chance that the entire transaction will be lost if the OS crashes or there is a loss of system power before the data is flushed to disk. Since such catastrophic events are rare most consumers should not need to concern themselves further.
transaction.title: IDBTransaction

widl-IDBCursor-advance-void-unsigned-lon.summary: The advance() method of the IDBCursor interface sets the number of times a cursor should move its position forward.
widl-IDBCursor-advance-void-unsigned-lon.title: IDBCursor.advance()

widl-IDBCursor-continue-void-any-key.summary: The continue() method of the IDBCursor interface advances the cursor to the next position along its direction, to the item whose key matches the optional key parameter. If no key is specified, the cursor advances to the immediate next position, based on its direction.
widl-IDBCursor-continue-void-any-key.title: IDBCursor.continue()

widl-IDBCursor-delete-IDBRequest.summary: An IDBRequest object on which subsequent events related to this operation are fired. The result attribute is set to undefined.
widl-IDBCursor-delete-IDBRequest.title: IDBCursor.delete()

widl-IDBCursor-direction.summary: A string (defined by the IDBCursorDirection enum) indicating the direction in which the cursor is traversing the data. Possible values are:
widl-IDBCursor-direction.title: IDBCursor.direction

widl-IDBCursor-primaryKey.summary: A value of any data type.
widl-IDBCursor-primaryKey.title: IDBCursor.primaryKey

widl-IDBCursor-source.summary: The IDBObjectStore or IDBIndex that the cursor is iterating over.
widl-IDBCursor-source.title: IDBCursor.source

widl-IDBCursor-source.summary: The value of the current cursor.
widl-IDBCursor-source.title: IDBCursorWithValue.value

widl-IDBCursor-update-IDBRequest-any-val.summary: The update() method of the IDBCursor interface returns an IDBRequest object, and, in a separate thread, updates the value at the current position of the cursor in the object store. If the cursor points to a record that has just been deleted, a new record is created.
widl-IDBCursor-update-IDBRequest-any-val.title: IDBCursor.update()

widl-IDBDatabase-close-void.summary: The connection is not actually closed until all transactions created using this connection are complete. No new transactions can be created for this connection once this method is called. Methods that create transactions throw an exception if a closing operation is pending.
widl-IDBDatabase-close-void.title: IDBDatabase.close()

widl-IDBDatabase-createObjectStore-IDBOb.summary: The method takes the name of the store as well as a parameter object that lets you define important optional properties. You can use the property to uniquely identify individual objects in the store. As the property is an identifier, it should be unique to every object, and every object should have that property.
widl-IDBDatabase-createObjectStore-IDBOb.title: IDBDatabase.createObjectStore()

widl-IDBDatabase-deleteObjectStore-void-.summary: As with IDBDatabase.createObjectStore, this method can be called only within a versionchange transaction.
widl-IDBDatabase-deleteObjectStore-void-.title: IDBDatabase.deleteObjectStore()

widl-IDBDatabase-name.summary: A DOMString containing the name of the connected database.
widl-IDBDatabase-name.title: IDBDatabase.name

widl-IDBDatabase-objectStoreNames.summary: A DOMStringList containing a list of the names of the object stores currently in the connected database.
widl-IDBDatabase-objectStoreNames.title: IDBDatabase.objectStoreNames

widl-IDBDatabase-objectStoreNames.summary: The objectStoreNames read-only property of the IDBTransaction interface returns a DOMStringList of names of IDBObjectStore objects.
widl-IDBDatabase-objectStoreNames.title: IDBTransaction.objectStoreNames

widl-IDBDatabase-onabort.summary: The onabort event handler of the IDBDatabase interface handles the abort event, fired when a transaction is aborted and bubbles up to the connection object.
widl-IDBDatabase-onabort.title: IDBDatabase.onabort

widl-IDBDatabase-onerror.summary: The onerror event handler of the IDBDatabase interface handles the error event, fired when a request returns an error and bubbles up to the connection object.
widl-IDBDatabase-onerror.title: IDBDatabase.onerror

widl-IDBDatabase-onversionchange.summary: This example shows an IDBOpenDBRequest.onupgradeneeded block that creates a new object store; it also includes onerror and onabort functions to handle non-success cases, and an onversionchange function to notify when a database structure change has occurred.
widl-IDBDatabase-onversionchange.title: IDBDatabase.onversionchange

widl-IDBDatabase-version.summary: An integer containing the version of the connected database.
widl-IDBDatabase-version.title: IDBDatabase.version

widl-IDBEnvironment-indexedDB.summary: The indexedDB read-only property of the WindowOrWorkerGlobalScope mixin provides a mechanism for applications to asynchronously access the capabilities of indexed databases.
widl-IDBEnvironment-indexedDB.title: WindowOrWorkerGlobalScope.indexedDB

widl-IDBFactory-cmp-short-any-first-any-.summary: An integer that indicates the result of the comparison; the table below lists the possible values and their meanings:
widl-IDBFactory-cmp-short-any-first-any-.title: IDBFactory.cmp()

widl-IDBFactory-deleteDatabase-IDBOpenDB.summary: The deleteDatabase() method of the IDBFactory interface requests the deletion of a database. The method returns an IDBOpenDBRequest object immediately, and performs the deletion operation asynchronously.
widl-IDBFactory-deleteDatabase-IDBOpenDB.title: IDBFactory.deleteDatabase()

widl-IDBFactory-open-IDBOpenDBRequest-DO.summary: If an error occurs while the database connection is being opened, then an error event is fired on the request object returned from this method.
widl-IDBFactory-open-IDBOpenDBRequest-DO.title: IDBFactory.open()

widl-IDBIndex-count-IDBRequest-any-key.summary: A IDBRequest object on which subsequent events related to this operation are fired.
widl-IDBIndex-count-IDBRequest-any-key.title: IDBIndex.count()

widl-IDBIndex-get-IDBRequest-any-key.summary: If a value is found, then a structured clone of it is created and set as the result of the request object: this returns the record the key is associated with.
widl-IDBIndex-get-IDBRequest-any-key.title: IDBIndex.get()

widl-IDBIndex-getKey-IDBRequest-any-key.summary: If a key is found it is set as the result of the request object: this returns the primary key of the record the key is associated with, not the whole record as IDBIndex.get does.
widl-IDBIndex-getKey-IDBRequest-any-key.title: IDBIndex.getKey()

widl-IDBIndex-keyPath.summary: Any data type that can be used as a key path.
widl-IDBIndex-keyPath.title: IDBIndex.keyPath

widl-IDBIndex-name.summary: A DOMString specifying a name for the index.
widl-IDBIndex-name.title: IDBIndex.name

widl-IDBIndex-openCursor-IDBRequest-any-.summary: The method sets the position of the cursor to the appropriate record, based on the specified direction.
widl-IDBIndex-openCursor-IDBRequest-any-.title: IDBIndex.openCursor()

widl-IDBIndex-openCursor-IDBRequest-any-.summary: To determine if the add operation has completed successfully, listen for the results’s success event.
widl-IDBIndex-openCursor-IDBRequest-any-.title: IDBObjectStore.openCursor()

widl-IDBIndex-openKeyCursor-IDBRequest-a.summary: The method sets the position of the cursor to the appropriate key, based on the specified direction.
widl-IDBIndex-openKeyCursor-IDBRequest-a.title: IDBIndex.openKeyCursor()

widl-IDBKeyRange-bound-IDBKeyRange-any-l.summary: IDBKeyRange: The newly created key range.
widl-IDBKeyRange-bound-IDBKeyRange-any-l.title: IDBKeyRange.bound()

widl-IDBKeyRange-lower.summary: The lower bound of the key range (can be any type.)
widl-IDBKeyRange-lower.title: IDBKeyRange.lower

widl-IDBKeyRange-lowerBound-IDBKeyRange-.summary: IDBKeyRange: The newly created key range.
widl-IDBKeyRange-lowerBound-IDBKeyRange-.title: IDBKeyRange.lowerBound()

widl-IDBKeyRange-only-IDBKeyRange-any-va.summary: value is the value for the new key range.
widl-IDBKeyRange-only-IDBKeyRange-any-va.title: IDBKeyRange.only()

widl-IDBKeyRange-upper.summary: The upper bound of the key range (can be any type.)
widl-IDBKeyRange-upper.title: IDBKeyRange.upper

widl-IDBKeyRange-upperBound-IDBKeyRange-.summary: IDBKeyRange: The newly created key range.
widl-IDBKeyRange-upperBound-IDBKeyRange-.title: IDBKeyRange.upperBound()

widl-IDBObjectStore-add-IDBRequest-any-v.summary: To determine if the add operation has completed successfully, listen for the transaction’s complete event in addition to the IDBObjectStore.add request’s success event, because the transaction may still fail after the success event fires. In other words, the success event is only triggered when the transaction has been successfully queued.
widl-IDBObjectStore-add-IDBRequest-any-v.title: IDBObjectStore.add()

widl-IDBObjectStore-clear-IDBRequest.summary: Clearing an object store consists of removing all records from the object store and removing all records in indexes that reference the object store. To remove only some of the records in a store, use IDBObjectStore.delete passing a key or IDBKeyRange.
widl-IDBObjectStore-clear-IDBRequest.title: IDBObjectStore.clear()

widl-IDBObjectStore-count-IDBRequest-any.summary: An IDBRequest object on which subsequent events related to this operation are fired.
widl-IDBObjectStore-count-IDBRequest-any.title: IDBObjectStore.count()

widl-IDBObjectStore-createIndex-IDBIndex.summary: Note that this method must be called only from a VersionChange transaction mode callback.
widl-IDBObjectStore-createIndex-IDBIndex.title: IDBObjectStore.createIndex()

widl-IDBObjectStore-delete-IDBRequest-an.summary: An IDBRequest object on which subsequent events related to this operation are fired. The request.result attribute is set to undefined.
widl-IDBObjectStore-delete-IDBRequest-an.title: IDBObjectStore.delete()

widl-IDBObjectStore-deleteIndex-void-DOM.summary: Note that this method must be called only from a VersionChange transaction mode callback. Note that this method synchronously modifies the IDBObjectStore.indexNames property.
widl-IDBObjectStore-deleteIndex-void-DOM.title: IDBObjectStore.deleteIndex()

widl-IDBObjectStore-get-IDBRequest-any-k.summary: If a value is successfully found, then a structured clone of it is created and set as the result of the request object.
widl-IDBObjectStore-get-IDBRequest-any-k.title: IDBObjectStore.get()

widl-IDBObjectStore-index-IDBIndex-DOMSt.summary: An IDBIndex object for accessing the index.
widl-IDBObjectStore-index-IDBIndex-DOMSt.title: IDBObjectStore.index()

widl-IDBObjectStore-keyPath.summary: If this property is null, the application must provide a key for each modification operation.
widl-IDBObjectStore-keyPath.title: IDBObjectStore.keyPath

widl-IDBObjectStore-name.summary: A DOMString containing the object store's name.
widl-IDBObjectStore-name.title: IDBObjectStore.name

widl-IDBObjectStore-put-IDBRequest-any-v.summary: The put method is an update or insert method. See the IDBObjectStore.add method for an insert only method.
widl-IDBObjectStore-put-IDBRequest-any-v.title: IDBObjectStore.put()

widl-IDBOpenDBRequest-onblocked.summary: The onblocked event handler of the IDBOpenDBRequest interface is the event handler for the blocked event. This event is triggered when the upgradeneeded should be triggered because of a version change but the database is still in use (that is, not closed) somewhere, even after the versionchange event was sent.
widl-IDBOpenDBRequest-onblocked.title: IDBOpenDBRequest.onblocked

widl-IDBOpenDBRequest-onupgradeneeded.summary: In the following example you can see the onupgradeneeded handler being used to update the database structure if a database with a higher version number is loaded. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)
widl-IDBOpenDBRequest-onupgradeneeded.title: IDBOpenDBRequest.onupgradeneeded

widl-IDBRequest-error.summary: A DOMError containing the relevant error. In Chrome 48+/Firefox 58+ this property returns a DOMException because DOMError has been removed from the DOM standard. The following error codes are returned under certain conditions:
widl-IDBRequest-error.title: IDBRequest.error

widl-IDBRequest-onerror.summary: The following example requests a given record title, onsuccess gets the associated record from the IDBObjectStore (made available as objectStoreTitleRequest.result), updates one property of the record, and then puts the updated record back into the object store. Also included at the bottom is an onerror function that reports what the error was if the request fails. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)
widl-IDBRequest-onerror.title: IDBRequest.onerror

widl-IDBRequest-onsuccess.summary: The following example requests a given record title, onsuccess gets the associated record from the IDBObjectStore (made available as objectStoreTitleRequest.result), updates one property of the record, and then puts the updated record back into the object store. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)
widl-IDBRequest-onsuccess.title: IDBRequest.onsuccess

widl-IDBRequest-readyState.summary: The IDBRequestReadyState of the request, which takes one of the following two values:
widl-IDBRequest-readyState.title: IDBRequest.readyState

widl-IDBRequest-source.summary: An object representing the source of the request, such as an IDBIndex, IDBObjectStore or IDBCursor.
widl-IDBRequest-source.title: IDBRequest.source

widl-IDBTransaction-abort-void.summary: All pending IDBRequest objects created during this transaction have their IDBRequest.error attribute set to AbortError.
widl-IDBTransaction-abort-void.title: IDBTransaction.abort()

widl-IDBTransaction-error.summary: A DOMError containing the relevant error. In Chrome 48+/Firefox 58+ this property returns a DOMException because DOMError has been removed from the DOM standard. The exact error is one of serveral possibilities. It can be a reference to the same error as the request object that raised it, or a transaction failure (for example QuotaExceededError or UnknownError).
widl-IDBTransaction-error.title: IDBTransaction.error

widl-IDBTransaction-mode.summary: An IDBTransactionMode object defining the mode for isolating access to data in the current object stores:
widl-IDBTransaction-mode.title: IDBTransaction.mode

widl-IDBTransaction-objectStore-IDBObjec.summary: Every call to this method on the same transaction object, with the same name, returns the same IDBObjectStore instance. If this method is called on a different transaction object, a different IDBObjectStore instance is returned.
widl-IDBTransaction-objectStore-IDBObjec.title: IDBTransaction.objectStore()

widl-IDBTransaction-onabort.summary: In the following code snippet, we open a read/write transaction on our database and add some data to an object store. Note also the functions attached to transaction event handlers to report on the outcome of the transaction opening in the event of success or failure. Note the transaction.onabort = function(event) { }; block, reporting when the transaction has been aborted. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)
widl-IDBTransaction-onabort.title: IDBTransaction.onabort

widl-IDBTransaction-oncomplete.summary: The oncomplete event handler of the IDBTransaction interface handles the complete event, fired when the transaction successfully completes.
widl-IDBTransaction-oncomplete.title: IDBTransaction.oncomplete

widl-IDBTransaction-ononerror.summary: The onerror event handler of the IDBTransaction interface handles the error event, fired when a request returns an error and bubbles up to the transaction object.
widl-IDBTransaction-ononerror.title: IDBTransaction.onerror

widl-IDBVersionChangeEvent-oldVersion.summary: The oldVersion read-only property of the IDBVersionChangeEvent interface returns the old version number of the database.
widl-IDBVersionChangeEvent-oldVersion.title: IDBVersionChangeEvent.oldVersion
